product.description: Horsetail extract ( Equisetum arvense ) comes from a unique type of grass plant in the Equisetaceae family, the only family of plants that reproduce using spores rather than seeds. Horsetail is a living fossil, being the only living genus of the entire class Equisetopsida in the world. Equisetopsida dominated the forests of the late Paleozoic era. Horsetail contains large amounts of silica, which give it an abrasive texture. Horsetail ( Equisetum arvense ) has been used for centuries by indigenous peoples for a variety of uses ranging from sandpaper to folk remedies.

What Is Purple Cornflower (Echinacea purpurea)?

Purple cornflower (Echinacea purpurea) is a group of herbaceous flower plants in the daisy family that are only found in a small region of North America. They grow in moist prairies and wooded areas and have large heads of composite flowers that bloom in the summer.


Purple Cornflower (Echinacea purpurea) Benefits

Purple cornflower (Echinacea purpurea) has been used as a folk remedy for hundreds of years. It helps with mood, supports the immune system, and is rich in antioxidants.† It acts as a natural anti-inflammatory and may also help maintain glucose levels when taken in conjunction with diet and exercise.†
